title: [Large-scale] Blended Learning Course for Strengthening Mathematics Instructional Design Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental grasp of mathematical principles and basic pedagogical theories
context.additional_context: A blended course for pre-service and in-service teachers to enhance mathematics instructional design competencies, combining theoretical learning with practical lesson design workshops. Learners use personal devices (BYOD) to engage in online modules and offline workshops.

learning_goals: Learners analyze the developmental processes of three major learning theories (behaviorism, cognitivism, constructivism), derive five instructional principles applicable to mathematics lesson design, and apply them to actual lesson scenarios for peer evaluation.
Develop a detailed lesson plan integrating mathematical content knowledge (KC) and pedagogical content knowledge (PCK).
Develop and evaluate interaction strategies for mathematics instruction utilizing digital tools (BYOD).
Improve mathematics teaching and learning materials by incorporating peer feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
